title: Oxford Space Systems Secures £3M in Additional Funding
summary:
UK-based deployable antenna manufacturer Oxford Space Systems has raised £3 million in funding that will be used to support the company’s growth. While Oxford Space Systems was founded in 2013, the company’s growth has accelerated over the last two years. In that period, the company has grown from 50 to 87 employees, supported five successful […]
The post Oxford Space Systems Secures £3M in Additional Funding appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Army to refine requirements for next-generation satellite terminals
summary: The U.S. Army plans to launch later this year a new procurement of satellite communication terminals.

title: Peregrine lunar lander on Earth reentry trajectory
summary: Astrobotic says its Peregrine spacecraft, unable to land on the moon because of a propellant leak, will instead reenter the Earth’s atmosphere in the coming days.

title: SpaceX says propellant venting caused loss of second Starship
summary: SpaceX Chief Executive Elon Musk says a propellant dump caused the destruction of the Starship upper stage on a November test flight, giving him confidence that the vehicle can reach orbit on its next launch.
